response_requirements.initial_response_description: Public body must permit inspection or copying within 10 business days of receiving request
response_requirements.final_response_notes: If not permitted within 10 business days, public body must explain need for additional time in writing; may have additional 20 business days if voluminous/difficult request
response_requirements.extension_notes: Additional 20 business days permitted if voluminous nature, number of pending requests, or difficulty in searching/retrieving makes additional time necessary to avoid undue burden

fee_structure.search_fee_notes: May charge $15/hour for search and retrieval time (based on lowest paid employee capable of task); first hour free

exemptions.description: Personnel and medical files and similar files where disclosure would constitute clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy
Preliminary drafts, notes, or interagency/intra-agency memoranda not retained in ordinary course of business
Records specifically exempted from disclosure by statute
Trade secrets and commercial or financial information obtained from person and privileged or confidential
Communications within or between public bodies of advisory nature covering non-factual materials preliminary to policy/action determination
Library records required by law to be kept confidential
Information that would jeopardize safety of personnel or public if disclosed

appeal_process.first_level_notes: May file complaint with Attorney General who investigates and may institute proceedings to compel access
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Court may award attorney fees and costs; civil fine up to $1,000 per violation for arbitrary or capricious denials

requester_requirements.purpose_notes: Public body may not require statement of purpose as condition for making records available
requester_requirements.request_format_notes: Written request preferred but not required on specific form; must be readily identifiable as records request
requester_requirements.specific_format: Request must be readily identifiable as public records request

agency_obligations.records_officer_notes: Must designate public records officer or unit
agency_obligations.response_format_options: May provide electronically, by facsimile, or by mail per requester's choice unless unduly burdensome
agency_obligations.segregation_required: Must provide reasonably segregable portions of partially exempt records
agency_obligations.written_procedures_required: Must adopt written procedures for public access and post on website

oversight_body.name: Attorney General
oversight_body.role: Investigates complaints and may institute court proceedings to compel access
oversight_body.contact_info: Rhode Island Office of Attorney General

validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields verified from official Rhode Island statute. 10 business day response required; additional 20 business days for voluminous/difficult requests. Attorney General complaint process available. Superior court mandamus action. Civil fines up to $1,000 for arbitrary denials. Maximum $0.15/page copies, $15/hour search fees after first hour. Purpose statements prohibited. Written procedures and designated records officer required.
